page.title: 08Mr.F.Stockton
page.content: Mr.F.Stockton aged 84 lived for many years at Timbersbrook.As a child he lived in a two up,two down terraced house in Buglawton.When he was young chips were 1d(1/2p).Now they are 32p. His father worked in a mill making football shirts At school Mr.Stockton was the Headmaster's errand boy.He took the attendance figures to the Education Office in Moody Street each day.Mr.Stockton left school on his 13th.birthday.He worked a milk round then a paper round.He obtained the milk from a farm with 3 cows. During the First World War he worked on munitions.He tried to enlist in the army but was too young. After the war he made paper bags before joining Eaton Mill.He remembered Â£1 notes being introduced. Only 3 men got Â£1 a week.The rest got 18s. and women received 11s.
